Review Content: I got turned onto this years ago at sushi bars and it tastes so similar to my own. pretty pricey at grocery stores per bottle so I looked on amazon. 6 bottles is not to much, pantry safe till opened & the fact that it's in a squirt bottle is so much better than watching people lick the knife & put it directly back into a jar. also, if you want to customize with garlic juice, mustard, sriracha or some wasabi go for it. you just can't do it when it's full, let it go down by about a 1/4. that's all.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2025
Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
Review Content:
I recently purchased the Kewpie Squeeze Mayonnaise, and I must say, it has completely transformed my mayo game. The squeeze bottle design is not only convenient but also ensures that I can effortlessly add just the right amount to my sandwiches, burgers, and salads without any mess. The 12-ounce size strikes the perfect balance between having enough to last but without taking up too much space in my fridge.

The flavor of this mayo is exceptional. It's rich, creamy, and has a unique taste that sets it apart from other mayonnaises. What's even better is that it's gluten-free, catering to those with dietary restrictions without compromising on taste. The Kewpie brand has truly delivered a mayonnaise that excels in both convenience and flavor. I highly recommend the Kewpie Squeeze Mayonnaise to anyone looking to elevate their culinary experience ‚Äì it's a 5-star product that has earned a permanent spot in my kitchen!

Review Content: The best way I could describe this to someone who has never tasted it before, is that it tastes like a very tangy mayonnaise lol. Like it has horseradish kind of twang. Ive only tried a taste of it off of my finger, and not on any food, but it isn't an awful taste, but definitely has an acquired taste

I hope you enjoy it.

Review Content: I like the taste of this. And love the squeeze bottle. I just had to try it after reading about it. Executive chefs love Kewpie Mayo. There is a Japanese made version with MSG which gives it the umami flavor and that is what the top chefs actually use. Search ‚Äú japanese kewpie mayonnaise‚Äù on Amazon and it will come up. It has different packaging. It‚Äôs $18.89 for a two pack and I paid it because I have to try it (if you try to order direct from Kewpie it‚Äôs $19.99 for one bottle). Now I won‚Äôt have to buy Mayo for awhile‚Ä¶

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
Review Content: This mayo has great flavor and texture but it is made in USA by the same company that makes it in Japan. It is good, but not so much better than Hellman's/Best Foods to justify the premium price. The real Japanese product is available at Amazon, but it is even more costly.

Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2018
Review Content:
Love this mayo! It's thicker than American mayo like Hellmann's. Japanese mayo is made with egg yolk instead of just egg white like typical American mayo that's why KewPie Mayo has a yellowish color and is thicker. It's also made with a different kind of vinegar instead of white vinegar. That also lends to a unique taste different than Hellmann's.

I originally used this for our tuna sushi burritos but you can use this for any dish that you use regular mayo in (deviled eggs, chicken or tuna salad, sandwiches, etc). If you like things spicy, you can make a spicy mayo by adding some sriracha sauce to it and giving it a stir.

I highly recommend this product to anyone who wants to experience something different but not wildly different. You can tell it's mayo and the taste, while unique, it's not so different from what you're used to that you'll find it strange. Give it a try!

Update: I just used this when making my usual crab salad. I had reached for my Hellmann's but saw this in the door and thought, "why not?" the crab salad came out very good. I actually preferred this mayo to my usual because it added a bit more flavor and texture (since it's thicker than the usual brand).

Review Content: I just love mayo. Hellman‚Äôs, since I‚Äôm too far north to find Duke‚Äôs in my itty-bitty grocery store. But I read a rave review in Bon Appetit Magazine and had to try Kewpie‚Äôs. However, for me the deal-breakers were 1) it‚Äôs more than 3 times as expensive for me than Hellman‚Äôs; and 2) I didn‚Äôt like the squeeze-bottle packaging. Even stored in the fridge upside down, I didn‚Äôt enjoy pounding it on the counter to coax forth the mayo. And when the spurting was finished, I just want that last tablespoon ‚Äî or perhaps more?
